KH.content: structural law: inevitability of tropology & anachronism, [desire for] totalizing apprehension of interpretations of khōra [re: translating, thinking khōra]
KH.linkedContent: structural law: inevitability of tropology & anachronism, [desire for] totalizing apprehension of interpretations of khōra [re: translating, thinking khōra]

KH.content: btwn text & theme, structure w/out an indivisible origin > theater of irony, w/out end, w/out bottom [abyss]; to isolate a theme, “philosophy-of-Plato,” would be to violently misrecognize, deny textual scene, questions of topology in general
KH.linkedContent: btwn text & theme, structure w/out an indivisible origin > theater of irony, w/out end, w/out bottom [abyss]; to isolate a theme, “philosophy-of-Plato,” would be to violently misrecognize, deny textual scene, questions of topology in general

GT.content: the foreseeable, programmed, conditioned, expected, counted on, necessary cannot be a gift or event
GT.linkedContent: the foreseeable, programmed, conditioned, expected, counted on, necessary cannot be a gift or event

GT.content: event, gift, must be structured by aleatory, remain unforeseeable w/out being kept so
GT.linkedContent: event, gift, must be structured by aleatory, remain unforeseeable w/out being kept so

R.content: structure of a promise: the memory of that which carries the future, the to-come, here and now
R.linkedContent: structure of a promise: the memory of that which carries the future, the to-come, here and now

AF.content: the structure of the archive is spectral [see p. 68]
AF.linkedContent: the structure of the archive is spectral [see p. 68]

A.content: via Heidegger, there is no culture of death itself of properly dying, question arises of limit btwn universal (non-natural) structure and differential (non-natural but cultural) structure
A.linkedContent: via Heidegger, there is no culture of death itself of properly dying, question arises of limit btwn universal (non-natural) structure and differential (non-natural but cultural) structure

EM.content: isn’t security of near trembling today? that is, the co-belonging/co-propriety of the name of man and name of Being, as it inhabits and is inhabited by language of West, such as it is buried in its oikonomia [house, tomb see DIF p. 4n], such as it is forgotten, and such as it is awakened by destruction of ontotheology? [trembling: announcement of deconstruction]
EM.linkedContent: isn’t security of near trembling today? that is, the co-belonging/co-propriety of the name of man and name of Being, as it inhabits and is inhabited by language of West, such as it is buried in its oikonomia [house, tomb see DIF p. 4n], such as it is forgotten, and such as it is awakened by destruction of ontotheology? [trembling: announcement of deconstruction]

EM.content: this trembling can only come from a certain outside—already requisite within the very structure that it solicits
EM.linkedContent: this trembling can only come from a certain outside—already requisite within the very structure that it solicits

EM.content: Derrida’s attention to system and structure, la réduction du sens, neither restores classical motifs nor erases them > rather, determining possibility du sens on basis of “formal” organization which in itself has no sens: a critique [sic] of phenomenologies (Husserl, Hegel), which aspire for une réduction au sens
EM.linkedContent: Derrida’s attention to system and structure, la réduction du sens, neither restores classical motifs nor erases them > rather, determining possibility du sens on basis of “formal” organization which in itself has no sens: a critique [sic] of phenomenologies (Husserl, Hegel), which aspire for une réduction au sens

MC.content: unforeseeability conditions the structure of the event

PP.content: Plato uses letter, alphabet, for pedagogical ends > never thematizes law of difference made apparent, the irreducibility of structure & relation, of proportionality, w/in analogy
PP.linkedContent: Plato uses letter, alphabet, for pedagogical ends > never thematizes law of difference made apparent, the irreducibility of structure & relation, of proportionality, w/in analogy

PP.content: la khōra est grosse de tout ce qui se dissémine ici, inscription produces the son and at the same time the constitution of structurality
PP.linkedContent: la khōra est grosse de tout ce qui se dissémine ici, inscription produces the son and at the same time the constitution of structurality

VM.content: langage, fils de la terre et du soleil: écriture > one could never come across a language w/out rupture of space, no aerial or aquatic language, in which alterity would be more lost than ever > structure of inside-outside/day-night has no meaning in pure space [proscribed words], inhabits conceptuality itself
VM.linkedContent: langage, fils de la terre et du soleil: écriture > one could never come across a language w/out rupture of space, no aerial or aquatic language, in which alterity would be more lost than ever > structure of inside-outside/day-night has no meaning in pure space [proscribed words], inhabits conceptuality itself

VM.content: structure [inside-outside] has no meaning w/out included origin, inscribed eastern horizon which is neither w/in nor w/out space
VM.linkedContent: structure [inside-outside] has no meaning w/out included origin, inscribed eastern horizon which is neither w/in nor w/out space

OH.content: democracy to-come not a Kantian regulative idea, not a certain future, but democracy that has structure of promise > memory of that which carries the to-come here and now
OH.linkedContent: democracy to-come not a Kantian regulative idea, not a certain future, but democracy that has structure of promise > memory of that which carries the to-come here and now

PAS.content: pas does not find itself in (dans) a labyrinth [topos], it carries itself along like a labyrinth, has the structure of a labyrinth
PAS.linkedContent: pas does not find itself in (dans) a labyrinth [topos], it carries itself along like a labyrinth, has the structure of a labyrinth

PAS.content: “from an earlier time (autrefois)” not a date, not past of an event, it’s the structure of a relation to it, the word, the moment
PAS.linkedContent: “from an earlier time (autrefois)” not a date, not past of an event, it’s the structure of a relation to it, the word, the moment

PAS.content: double band is structure of name said to be proper, anonymity is the effect, whether by monumentalization (sauf, the unscathed) or effacement (seeds, dispersion); gift of name is corrupted in advance dans le pas-de-nom [plus-de-nom] > what takes place in and beyond language: leaves the fold of this folding back
PAS.linkedContent: double band is structure of name said to be proper, anonymity is the effect, whether by monumentalization (sauf, the unscathed) or effacement (seeds, dispersion); gift of name is corrupted in advance dans le pas-de-nom [plus-de-nom] > what takes place in and beyond language: leaves the fold of this folding back

VP.content: structure of supplement: “a possibility produces by delay that to which it is said to be added”
VP.linkedContent: structure of supplement: “a possibility produces by delay that to which it is said to be added”

VP.content: “my death is structurally necessary to pronouncing the ‘I,’” it is an active structure, and it must function against all falsehood, meaning “I am dead” must function as Bedeutung outside of intuition (fact of my death)
VP.linkedContent: “my death is structurally necessary to pronouncing the ‘I,’” it is an active structure, and it must function against all falsehood, meaning “I am dead” must function as Bedeutung outside of intuition (fact of my death)

FWT.content: there is a universal “structure” of heteronomic election: this election of each gives to all responsibility worthy of the name
FWT.linkedContent: there is a universal “structure” of heteronomic election: this election of each gives to all responsibility worthy of the name

POOF.content: the structural law of the event is absolute urgency
POOF.linkedContent: the structural law of the event is absolute urgency

POOF.content: “O my friends…” a call, a promise, a prayer (eukhé) [neither true nor false, Aristotle] > can’t give friendship, were friendship not still to come [Heideggerian ek-stasis] > in the name of friendship, “no friend” respectfully declares the perfect sovereign friendship impossible
POOF.linkedContent: “O my friends…” a call, a promise, a prayer (eukhé) [neither true nor false, Aristotle] > can’t give friendship, were friendship not still to come [Heideggerian ek-stasis] > in the name of friendship, “no friend” respectfully declares the perfect sovereign friendship impossible

POOF.content: vous-mes-amis-soyez-mes-amis-et-bien-que-vous-ne-le-soyez-pas-encore-vous-l’êtes-déjà-puisque-je-vous-appelle-ainsi: “O my friends…” has structure & temporality of messianic teleiopoesis
POOF.linkedContent: vous-mes-amis-soyez-mes-amis-et-bien-que-vous-ne-le-soyez-pas-encore-vous-l’êtes-déjà-puisque-je-vous-appelle-ainsi: “O my friends…” has structure & temporality of messianic teleiopoesis

POOF.content: the 2 names: 1) very structure of testimonial survival stance, a certain spectrality, name survives a priori beyond presence 2) this general structure is enframed (arraisonné) in certain history, chance of filiation, inherited name, that of renown (again, woman excluded)
POOF.linkedContent: the 2 names: 1) very structure of testimonial survival stance, a certain spectrality, name survives a priori beyond presence 2) this general structure is enframed (arraisonné) in certain history, chance of filiation, inherited name, that of renown (again, woman excluded)

DS.content: to write that such a movement [practice of spacing, antre ouvert, insertion] plays along a structure of supplementarity, surplus, vicariousness, is, literally, to quote
DS.linkedContent: to write that such a movement [practice of spacing, antre ouvert, insertion] plays along a structure of supplementarity, surplus, vicariousness, is, literally, to quote

DS.content: hymen is the structure of and/or, btwn and and or
DS.linkedContent: hymen is the structure of and/or, btwn and and or

POS.content: differance incompatible w/ static, synchronic, taxonomic, ahistoric motifs in concept of structure because of generativity (via transformation) of a of differance; production of differance not astructural (produces regulated, systematic transformations, even structural science), differance even develops most legitimate exigencies of “structuralism”
POS.linkedContent: differance incompatible w/ static, synchronic, taxonomic, ahistoric motifs in concept of structure because of generativity (via transformation) of a of differance; production of differance not astructural (produces regulated, systematic transformations, even structural science), differance even develops most legitimate exigencies of “structuralism”

POS.content: couple outside/inside, language as “expression,” are structural lures (what Kant would’ve called a transcendental illusion)
POS.linkedContent: couple outside/inside, language as “expression,” are structural lures (what Kant would’ve called a transcendental illusion)

POS.content: gathering Derrida’s work into a “sheaf,” historic/systematic crossroads, is structural impossibility of limiting network of differance, not a master-word, always finds itself in others
POS.linkedContent: gathering Derrida’s work into a “sheaf,” historic/systematic crossroads, is structural impossibility of limiting network of differance, not a master-word, always finds itself in others

POS.content: writing structurally carries w/in itself (counts-discounts) its own erasure, while marking what remains of this erasure
POS.linkedContent: writing structurally carries w/in itself (counts-discounts) its own erasure, while marking what remains of this erasure

ROP.content: for Foucault, psychoanalysis oscillates on both sides of dividing line, in two places, two times, at same time (but he does not think these two times w/ structural possibility of event)
ROP.linkedContent: for Foucault, psychoanalysis oscillates on both sides of dividing line, in two places, two times, at same time (but he does not think these two times w/ structural possibility of event)

SP.content: does one assume one’s own signature? formulation of such question disqualified by structure of the signature: (la signature/tombe)
SP.linkedContent: does one assume one’s own signature? formulation of such question disqualified by structure of the signature: (la signature/tombe)

SP.content: were the key to the secret of a text “btwn me and myself,” I will still die > relation to event of text as structurally posthumous necessity > text remains open, offered, undecipherable
SP.linkedContent: were the key to the secret of a text “btwn me and myself,” I will still die > relation to event of text as structurally posthumous necessity > text remains open, offered, undecipherable

GSP.content: is Husserl respectful of that which remains open w/in structure, even when one thinks the opening of structure as structural? [faithful comprehension meets no choice]
GSP.linkedContent: is Husserl respectful of that which remains open w/in structure, even when one thinks the opening of structure as structural? [faithful comprehension meets no choice]

GSP.content: structuralist demand: descriptions of totality w/ internal legality (each element has meaning in its solidarity of correlation/opposition with every other); genetic demand: origin, foundation of structure > Husserl ceaselessly tried to reconcile the 2
GSP.linkedContent: structuralist demand: descriptions of totality w/ internal legality (each element has meaning in its solidarity of correlation/opposition with every other); genetic demand: origin, foundation of structure > Husserl ceaselessly tried to reconcile the 2

GSP.content: neither structure (which isolates objective significations in their static originality) nor genesis (which effects abusive transitions from one region to the other) clarifies Husserl’s problem: foundation of objectivity
GSP.linkedContent: neither structure (which isolates objective significations in their static originality) nor genesis (which effects abusive transitions from one region to the other) clarifies Husserl’s problem: foundation of objectivity

PS.content: acc. Artaud, membering is dismembering; structure always structure of expropriation; “every organ is a parasite” of the body; Heart: “dirtiest means a being could have invented to pump life inside me”
PS.linkedContent: acc. Artaud, membering is dismembering; structure always structure of expropriation; “every organ is a parasite” of the body; Heart: “dirtiest means a being could have invented to pump life inside me”

PS.content: fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish: must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference
PS.linkedContent: fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish: must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference

FS.content: w/in structure there’s not only form, relation & configuration > there’s an interdependency & totality that is always concrete
FS.linkedContent: w/in structure there’s not only form, relation & configuration > there’s an interdependency & totality that is always concrete

FS.content: structure is the formal unity of form & meaning
FS.linkedContent: structure is the formal unity of form & meaning

FS.content: to see structure more clearly, solicit it, threaten its supports: concentrate on its [structuralism’s] keystone (la clef de voûte) (possibility & fragility of its existence) > the secret place where structure is neither construction nor ruin but lability
FS.linkedContent: to see structure more clearly, solicit it, threaten its supports: concentrate on its [structuralism’s] keystone (la clef de voûte) (possibility & fragility of its existence) > the secret place where structure is neither construction nor ruin but lability

FS.content: Derrida shows how structuralism can rely on dimension of height, where values mount scalewise & Good is most high, to think quality (inner intensity) w/ out giving up on structure
FS.linkedContent: Derrida shows how structuralism can rely on dimension of height, where values mount scalewise & Good is most high, to think quality (inner intensity) w/ out giving up on structure

FS.content: in structuralism, structure as one w/ geometrism: preformationsim, teleologism, reduction of force, value & duration
FS.linkedContent: in structuralism, structure as one w/ geometrism: preformationsim, teleologism, reduction of force, value & duration

FS.content: logos spermatikos: adult in miniature, encasement, anthropomorphic concept, preformationsim, biological idea, totality of hereditary characteristics enveloped in germ
FS.linkedContent: logos spermatikos: adult in miniature, encasement, anthropomorphic concept, preformationsim, biological idea, totality of hereditary characteristics enveloped in germ

FS.content: difference btwn Dionysus & Apollo, ardor & structure, cannot be erased in history, because not in history > it’s an original structure, the opening of history, historicity itself
FS.linkedContent: difference btwn Dionysus & Apollo, ardor & structure, cannot be erased in history, because not in history > it’s an original structure, the opening of history, historicity itself

DIF.content: strategically differance seemed most proper one [?] to think/master, though maintained w/in structural limits of mastery
DIF.linkedContent: strategically differance seemed most proper one [?] to think/master, though maintained w/in structural limits of mastery

O.content: structure of double mark (caught [pris], both seized [emprunté] & entangled [enfermé], in binary opposition)
O.linkedContent: structure of double mark (caught [pris], both seized [emprunté] & entangled [enfermé], in binary opposition)

O.content: one of the terms retains old name to destroy opposition to which it no longer quite belongs
O.linkedContent: one of the terms retains old name to destroy opposition to which it no longer quite belongs

O.content: repetition w/out identity, one mark inside, the other outside deconstructed system: double reading, double writing, double science: structure itself is worked in turn
O.linkedContent: repetition w/out identity, one mark inside, the other outside deconstructed system: double reading, double writing, double science: structure itself is worked in turn

O.content: no concept, no name, no signifier can escape this structure
O.linkedContent: no concept, no name, no signifier can escape this structure

O.content: “transcendental signified” arrests writing [in structure of double mark this arrest can no longer occur, writing as possibility of living on, arrêt de mort]; can’t master a structure w/out mastery
O.linkedContent: “transcendental signified” arrests writing [in structure of double mark this arrest can no longer occur, writing as possibility of living on, arrêt de mort]; can’t master a structure w/out mastery

O.content: neither formalism nor thematism can master irremediable structure of gap btwn empty form/full meaning: will miss it in attempt to master it
O.linkedContent: neither formalism nor thematism can master irremediable structure of gap btwn empty form/full meaning: will miss it in attempt to master it

O.content: structure of feint > always an extra turn (un tour de plus)
O.linkedContent: structure of feint > always an extra turn (un tour de plus)

O.content: the point is to work to set up or dismantle a scaffold, a scaffolding (un échafaudage), we need one to substitute, the time of a lapse, Mallarmé’s lustre for Plato’s sun
O.linkedContent: the point is to work to set up or dismantle a scaffold, a scaffolding (un échafaudage), we need one to substitute, the time of a lapse, Mallarmé’s lustre for Plato’s sun

TB.content: Babel as metaphor of metaphor, narrative of narrative, translation of translation: not only structure hollowing itself out like that, but does so in its own way > its idiom would have to be saved
TB.linkedContent: Babel as metaphor of metaphor, narrative of narrative, translation of translation: not only structure hollowing itself out like that, but does so in its own way > its idiom would have to be saved

TB.content: does a work require translation? answer is apodictic, injunction even w/out translator there, the requirement of the other as translator: structure of original, relation of life to survival > a priori, even if forgotten > its apodictic essence: it is unforgettable, so forgetting is accidental, death would not change it at all
TB.linkedContent: does a work require translation? answer is apodictic, injunction even w/out translator there, the requirement of the other as translator: structure of original, relation of life to survival > a priori, even if forgotten > its apodictic essence: it is unforgettable, so forgetting is accidental, death would not change it at all

CHM.content: [Derrida asks question about Foucault’s responsibility, the manner in which Foucault seems to return to innocence, end all complicity] doesn’t suffice to imprison the delegate, the psychiatrist, and in doing so the whole adventure of Western reason (acc. Foucault, capture & objectification of madness): wouldn’t Foucault’s proceedings, verdict, reiterate the crime?
CHM.linkedContent: [Derrida asks question about Foucault’s responsibility, the manner in which Foucault seems to return to innocence, end all complicity] doesn’t suffice to imprison the delegate, the psychiatrist, and in doing so the whole adventure of Western reason (acc. Foucault, capture & objectification of madness): wouldn’t Foucault’s proceedings, verdict, reiterate the crime?

CHM.content: if the Order is as powerful as Foucault says it is: infinite, universal complicity of those who understand “this language”
CHM.linkedContent: if the Order is as powerful as Foucault says it is: infinite, universal complicity of those who understand “this language”

CHM.content: “no Trojan horse unconquerable  by reason,” the best spokesman of the mad are those who betray them best
CHM.linkedContent: “no Trojan horse unconquerable by reason,” the best spokesman of the mad are those who betray them best

CHM.content: from heights of “to-attempt-to-say-the-demonic-hyperbole”: absolute opening, uneconomic expenditure, thought announces itself, frightens itself, reassures itself against annihilation by madness/death > always re-embraced by economy > relation btwn reason, madness, death is an economy: structure of deferral whose originality must be respected
CHM.linkedContent: from heights of “to-attempt-to-say-the-demonic-hyperbole”: absolute opening, uneconomic expenditure, thought announces itself, frightens itself, reassures itself against annihilation by madness/death > always re-embraced by economy > relation btwn reason, madness, death is an economy: structure of deferral whose originality must be respected

CHM.content: vouloir-dire-l’hyperbole condition of silence, not voluntarism but a 1st passion, il garde en lui la trace d’une violence, more written than said: differance of absolute excess (economy btwn that which exceeds and exceeded totality)
CHM.linkedContent: vouloir-dire-l’hyperbole condition of silence, not voluntarism but a 1st passion, il garde en lui la trace d’une violence, more written than said: differance of absolute excess (economy btwn that which exceeds and exceeded totality)

RM.content: Derrida’s “disconcerting (déroutante) tactic” to use usure doubly, not wily, manipulative or triumphant perversity: “corresponds to intractable structure in which we are limited & carried away in advance”
RM.linkedContent: Derrida’s “disconcerting (déroutante) tactic” to use usure doubly, not wily, manipulative or triumphant perversity: “corresponds to intractable structure in which we are limited & carried away in advance”

RM.content: via Ereignis, re- of retrait no accident, no accident occurring to trait, does not appear, no proper, structurally in withdrawal: gap, trace, border, traction, effraction, differentiality
RM.linkedContent: via Ereignis, re- of retrait no accident, no accident occurring to trait, does not appear, no proper, structurally in withdrawal: gap, trace, border, traction, effraction, differentiality

PJP.content: structural signification of oath, Law itself, origin of Law: commit to not be affected by time
PJP.linkedContent: structural signification of oath, Law itself, origin of Law: commit to not be affected by time

PJP.content: but the perjurer can always plead the discontinuity of time
PJP.linkedContent: but the perjurer can always plead the discontinuity of time

PJP.content: anacoluthon, generalized, causes all “subjects” to tremble (disturbance of identification), passes border btwn fiction/reality, btwn literature/testimony > even if erases border still a highly significant structural field: the duel of friendship, the question of “us”
PJP.linkedContent: anacoluthon, generalized, causes all “subjects” to tremble (disturbance of identification), passes border btwn fiction/reality, btwn literature/testimony > even if erases border still a highly significant structural field: the duel of friendship, the question of “us”

D.content: obsessive desire to escape due to structure of the text, obsession always textual
D.linkedContent: obsessive desire to escape due to structure of the text, obsession always textual

D.content: textuality is obsidional: undecidable process of opening/closing—no letup (sans cesse)
D.linkedContent: textuality is obsidional: undecidable process of opening/closing—no letup (sans cesse)

+R.content: acc. Benjamin [theory of revolution], never stock up on apparatus w/out transforming its very structure, twisting it, betraying, attracting it out of its element
+R.linkedContent: acc. Benjamin [theory of revolution], never stock up on apparatus w/out transforming its very structure, twisting it, betraying, attracting it out of its element

C.content: remainder itself, in its structure as remainder, will have been w/out (w/out example, w/out precedent)
C.linkedContent: remainder itself, in its structure as remainder, will have been w/out (w/out example, w/out precedent)

LI.content: absence of receiver from sender is possible not necessary, but this possibility is a must, is a structural necessity > possibility of an absence always inscribed, necessarily inscribed as possibility
LI.linkedContent: absence of receiver from sender is possible not necessary, but this possibility is a must, is a structural necessity > possibility of an absence always inscribed, necessarily inscribed as possibility

LI.content: structural & essential, iterability is at work in all facts, each mark divided or multiplied in advance > a more powerful “logic”—graphics of iterability undercuts classical opposition of fact & principle (le droit), factual & possible (virtual), necessity & possibility
LI.linkedContent: structural & essential, iterability is at work in all facts, each mark divided or multiplied in advance > a more powerful “logic”—graphics of iterability undercuts classical opposition of fact & principle (le droit), factual & possible (virtual), necessity & possibility

LI.content: iterability disrupts presence, unity of ego in sender, du maintenant-écrivain (grasping w/ 1 hand his ballpoint pen) > stigmè of every mark already split
LI.linkedContent: iterability disrupts presence, unity of ego in sender, du maintenant-écrivain (grasping w/ 1 hand his ballpoint pen) > stigmè of every mark already split

LI.content: structural possibilities: what makes it happen even before it happens
LI.linkedContent: structural possibilities: what makes it happen even before it happens

LI.content: [from SEC] structural unconsciousness, absence of intending actual utterance, prohibits any saturation of context (total presence)
LI.linkedContent: [from SEC] structural unconsciousness, absence of intending actual utterance, prohibits any saturation of context (total presence)

LI.content: [vis-à-vis iterability altering, contaminating] no choice but to mean to say something other than what we mean to say: accident is never an accident
LI.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis iterability altering, contaminating] no choice but to mean to say something other than what we mean to say: accident is never an accident

LI.content: parasitic structure: writing, graft, mark, marche, margin, differance, undecidable, supplement, pharmakon, hymen, parergon
as though an auxiliary/parasite could not supplant, as if “parasite” is a simple addition
LI.linkedContent: as though an auxiliary/parasite could not supplant, as if “parasite” is a simple addition

LI.content: when Derrida uses the term infrastructural (not meant as substratum beneath Marxist superstructure), but: recalls concept of text, not book, not discourse, not idealogical sphere: all structures called “real,” “economic,” “historical,” socio-institutional > all possible referents
LI.linkedContent: when Derrida uses the term infrastructural (not meant as substratum beneath Marxist superstructure), but: recalls concept of text, not book, not discourse, not idealogical sphere: all structures called “real,” “economic,” “historical,” socio-institutional > all possible referents

LI.content: every referent, all reality, has structure of a differential trace, can only refer to “real” in an interpretive experience
LI.linkedContent: every referent, all reality, has structure of a differential trace, can only refer to “real” in an interpretive experience

BSi.content: inventive, passionate, compulsive hallucination of fantastical beasts (zoopoetic fictions): essential structure of political sovereignty, codified rhetoric, law of genre [?]
BSi.linkedContent: inventive, passionate, compulsive hallucination of fantastical beasts (zoopoetic fictions): essential structure of political sovereignty, codified rhetoric, law of genre [?]

BSi.content: liberty & sovereignty (its limitless “I can”) are indissociable, double bind in 2 senses: 1) double injunction 2) duplicity in very concept of binding, obligation, bind, bond: stricture rather than structure, stricture that limits liberty along w/ sovereignty or sovereignty along w/ liberty
BSi.linkedContent: liberty & sovereignty (its limitless “I can”) are indissociable, double bind in 2 senses: 1) double injunction 2) duplicity in very concept of binding, obligation, bind, bond: stricture rather than structure, stricture that limits liberty along w/ sovereignty or sovereignty along w/ liberty

BSi.content: double bind [#1 above]: deconstruct ontotheology of sovereignty w/out questioning liberty in name of which we put this deconstruction to work: think liberty differently, w/in distribution of a divisible sovereignty > think unconditional w/out indivisible sovereignty
BSi.linkedContent: double bind [#1 above]: deconstruct ontotheology of sovereignty w/out questioning liberty in name of which we put this deconstruction to work: think liberty differently, w/in distribution of a divisible sovereignty > think unconditional w/out indivisible sovereignty

OG.content: Saussure’s (Aristotle’s) phonocentrism: voix—state of soul; writing—symbols of voix
one should call this a model, and not a structure, of a certain kind of writing: it does not function perfectly, but there’s an ideal directing a function ([thus] never completely phonetic)
OG.linkedContent: one should call this a model, and not a structure, of a certain kind of writing: it does not function perfectly, but there’s an ideal directing a function ([thus] never completely phonetic)

OG.content: originary differance is supplementarity as structure: irreducible complexity of shifting play of absence/presence: metaphysics produced by it, doesn’t think it: writing is a representation of trace, trace itself does not exist > place of decision now hidden, but still indicated
OG.linkedContent: originary differance is supplementarity as structure: irreducible complexity of shifting play of absence/presence: metaphysics produced by it, doesn’t think it: writing is a representation of trace, trace itself does not exist > place of decision now hidden, but still indicated

OG.content: structural analysis can cycle back to point zero w/ concept of catastrophic event:  structuralism does not follow linear genesis
OG.linkedContent: structural analysis can cycle back to point zero w/ concept of catastrophic event: structuralism does not follow linear genesis

EU.content: translating structure begins as soon as a reading of “original” text is instituted, offers up language to be read in its very erasure: erased traces of a path (odos), chemin d’effacement, translation passing over/beyond the path of language [beyond Heidegger], passant son chemin
EU.linkedContent: translating structure begins as soon as a reading of “original” text is instituted, offers up language to be read in its very erasure: erased traces of a path (odos), chemin d’effacement, translation passing over/beyond the path of language [beyond Heidegger], passant son chemin

EU.content: response: initial form & minimal requirement of responsibility > structure of call to responsibility so anterior to any positive response—nonresponse a priori assumes responsibility
EU.linkedContent: response: initial form & minimal requirement of responsibility > structure of call to responsibility so anterior to any positive response—nonresponse a priori assumes responsibility

SPEC.content: an abyss of more than one generation [Freud & Ernst] (also said about computers), an a priori of an aftereffect (d’un après-coup) [Derrida doing this too?] > formal structure se donne à lire once objects can substitute for each other (laying bare substitutive structure itself)

FV.content: literature that puts truth on stage, can it be read by psychoanalysis? abyssal structure, this space overflowed by powers of simulacrum
FV.linkedContent: literature that puts truth on stage, can it be read by psychoanalysis? abyssal structure, this space overflowed by powers of simulacrum

FV.content: coincidence in Poe; point is to show that due to structure of effects of framing—no totalization of bordering can occur: frame always enframed, parts w/out a whole
